name: Breaking The Fourth Wall Quiz | Entertainment | 10 Questions

questions.text: "Fight Club" had several scenes that broke the fourth wall. Who were the actors who did the majority of talking to the audience in the movie?
questions.explanation:
Brad Pitt/Edward Norton.

	"Fight Club" starred Edward Norton as the unnamed narrator with a dangerous alter ego named Tyler Durden, played by Brad Pitt.

questions.text: Which mustached private investigator broke the fourth wall in every episode of his 1980s TV series?
questions.explanation:
Magnum, PI.

	"Magnum, PI" aired on CBS from 1980 to 1988. One of the key points of Magnum was how he always directed a question, comment, or look toward the camera in each episode. Tom Selleck, who starred as Magnum, also narrated the series.

questions.text: In "Annie Hall", where did Woody Allen break the fourth wall after getting upset over a stranger's remarks?
questions.explanation:
Movie theater.

	While in line at a movie theater with Diane Keaton, Woody Allen's character told the audience that he would like to have a sock full of manure to use against the guy behind him who was stating his opinion on Marshall Mcluhan.

questions.text: The star of "Lord of War" opened the movie by breaking the fourth wall and giving the audience some statistics on guns. Who played the star character?
questions.explanation:
Nicolas Cage.

	Nicolas Cage opened the movie by telling the audience that there are 550 million firearms in the world which would supply one out of twelve people with guns. Nicolas played Yuri Orlov, an arms dealer.

questions.text: In what movie did character Harry Lockhart and Gay Perry wrap up the movie by thanking the audience and asking them to stay for the end credits?
questions.explanation:
Kiss Kiss, Bang Bang.

	"Kiss Kiss, Bang Bang" was a 2005 movie with Robert Downey Jr. and Val Kilmer. Robert Downey Jr. played a thief pretending to be an actor who gets involved in a murder investigation. At the end of the movie, Robert Downey Jr. thanks everyone for coming and offers a little more information on what happened to Harry after the movie's end.

questions.text: Liz Lemon broke the fourth wall by asking a phone company if "30 Rock" could have their money for an advertisement that she did while on the air. What phone company did she ask?
questions.explanation:
Verizon.

	Liz Lemon's "Can we have our money now?" quote to Verizon came from the second season episode "Somebody to Love".

questions.text: Rob Gordon broke the fourth wall by telling the audience five things he loved about his girlfriend in "High Fidelity". What actor played Rob Gordon?
questions.explanation:
John Cusack.

	As Rob Gordon, John Cusack played a record store owner who recounted five of his breakups. His last scene was giving a list of five things he loved about the woman who most recently broke up with him.

questions.text: The series finale of "Hercules, The Legendary Journeys" had the only instance of a character breaking the fourth wall. Which character broke the fourth wall by telling the audience, "Folks, my partner"?
questions.explanation:
Hercules.

	Hercules broke the fourth wall by making a remark to the audience that the heroic man running away is Iolaus his partner. "Full Circle" would be the last episode of "Hercules, The Legend Continues".

questions.text: Kevin Spacey broke the fourth wall when he told audiences, "Power is the old stone building that stands for centuries. I cannot respect someone who doesn't see the difference" in the series "House of _____"?
questions.explanation:
Cards.

	"House of Cards" is a Netflix original series based on the life of fictitious Majority Whip leader Francis Underwood.

questions.text: In what movie was the audience told, "Life moves pretty fast. If you don't stop and look around once in a while, you could miss it"?
questions.explanation:
Ferris Bueller's Day Off.

	"Ferris Bueller's Day Off" was a 1988 box office smash starring Matthew Broderick. Ferris broke the fourth wall in this movie several times.
